mechanoreception.notes: Copepods generally rely on mechanoreception to detect vibrations and water currents for prey detection, predator avoidance, and mate finding. Inferred to be present in Scolecitrichidae as a common trait across copepods.

chemoreception.notes: Copepods use chemoreception to detect chemical cues in the water, aiding in prey localization and mate recognition. Likely plays a role in Scolecitrichidae feeding and reproduction.

photoreception.notes: Presence and functionality of photoreceptors in Scolecitrichidae is unknown. Copepods can possess simple eyespots or more complex eyes depending on their habitat and lifestyle.
